meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by being more clever or cunning
meanings.sent1: She thought she could outfool her friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: The detective was outfooling the criminal with his clever tactics.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was outfooling the dog by hiding behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The magician outfooled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The fox outfooled the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.

meanings.definition: The act of outsmarting or outwitting someone
meanings.sent1: His outfooling of the opponent earned him the championship title.
meanings.sent2: Outfooling requires quick thinking and strategic planning.
meanings.sent3: The outfooling in the chess match was impressive to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her outfooling of the bully gained her respect among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The outfooling in the game was the highlight of the competition.

meanings.definition: To surpass in fooling or trickery
meanings.sent1: The master illusionist could outfool any other magician in the industry.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his ability to outfool even the most cunning opponents.
meanings.sent3: The siblings engaged in a friendly competition to see who could outfool the other.
meanings.sent4: The con artist outfooled his victims with his smooth talking.
meanings.sent5: The spy outfooled the enemy agents with his disguise and quick thinking.
